image.altText: Two women standing out the front of a women's shelter.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal-led domestic violence support service is demanding answers over stalled progress in establishing a women's shelter in remote Northern Territory.

title.children: Women's shelter demands answers from government, land council

image.altText: A jockey on a horse smiling, leaning forward to pat its head, with a crowd in the background.

props.synopsis: Two years after a near-fatal fall, 25-year-old Alice Springs-born jockey has had a bumper season with 32 wins. Now he is riding in the Melbourne Cup.

title.children: Alice Springs jockey to ride in Cup two years after near-fatal fall

image.altText: A woman wearing a visor and holding a tennis racket stands in a tennis court next to a loop fence.

props.synopsis: The impending departure of Rio Tinto raises concerns about the future of sporting clubs in Nhulunbuy. But there are hopes increased investment in regional sports can help sustain the community's active lifestyle.

title.children: Sporting clubs fear the worst as mining giant withdraws from Nhulunbuy

image.altText: A healthcare worker giving a Band-Aid to a young Indigenous child.

props.synopsis: Imagine visiting a health clinic where you may be exposed to asbestos, leaking roofs and lead in the water pipes. That's the reality for remote NT residents.

title.children: Asbestos, lead, a leaky roof: Healthcare in remote NT

image.altText: Stationary construction vehicles and various pieces of equipment dotted around a large patch of red dirt by the water's edge.

props.synopsis: The NT government will gain no direct revenue from the ship lift project, despite spending $820 million on its construction.

title.children: Darwin ship lift should proceed despite $720m cost increase, report finds

image.altText: A wide shot of a sign reading Tanumbirini Station with windmills in the distance.

props.synopsis: One of the Northern Territory's largest beef producers has failed in its bid to stop a gas company from trademarking the name of one of its cattle stations.

title.children: A cattle station and gas company have locked horns over the name 'Tanumbirini'

image.altText: Royal Darwin Hospital Intensive Care Unit

props.synopsis: The Acacia system was switched off at Royal Darwin Hospital's emergency department in January 2024 after it became a threat to patient safety.

title.children: Controversial patient record system to return to NT emergency department

image.altText: An Indigenous woman standing outside a construction site.

props.synopsis: Decades after Wadeye's last licensed social club was smashed to pieces amid a storm of controversy, locals will soon be able to have an after-work drink again.

title.children: Remote Aboriginal community returning to licensed liquor after 30 years

image.altText: Henry Pollock celebrates

props.synopsis: The Wallabies were overpowered by a disciplined and ruthless England team, who won their eighth-straight international to claim victory at Twickenham.

title.children: 'Woeful' Wallabies slammed by World Cup winner as England dominates

image.altText: A man with blonde hair in a suit shakes hand with a man with black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's gains are immediate and personal while Xi Jinping's are quiet, reversible, and strategic

title.children: Silence was strategy, not oversight in Trump's meeting with Xi

image.altText: A still of Daniel Jarvis standing with the Kangaroos team during the national anthem before second Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: A man is arrested by police after he lined up next to Cameron Munster before the Kangaroos's victory over England in the second Ashes Test in England.

title.children: Pitch invader stands with Kangaroos during national anthems before Ashes Test

image.altText: Kirsha Kaechele

props.synopsis: No men are allowed at Kirsha Kaechele's Ladies Lounge and the Supreme Court agrees. The artist, curator and "missus" of MONA's owner knows how to cross boundaries, but can she solve Tasmania's thorniest dispute?

title.children: MONA's 'first lady' banned men and was sued. She loved every moment

image.altText: A graphic of playing cards falling through a basketball net

props.synopsis: The New York mafia is alive and an "historic" FBI bust has shown that underworld crime is still kicking across the United States.

title.children: New York's underbelly is thriving — this FBI case pulled back the curtain

image.altText: Murray Watt presser

props.synopsis: As it negotiates with the Greens and the Coalition over its proposed overhaul of environment laws, Labor is preparing a campaign accusing the minor party of obstructing its agenda.

title.children: Labor takes fight to Greens in key seats over environment laws

image.altText: Donald Trump, wearing a suit and red tie, speaks behind a sign that says United States.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is threatening to pull US aid and going "guns-a-blazing" as he accuses the Nigerian government of allowing the killing of Christians.

title.children: Trump warns Nigeria of military action over alleged killings of Christians

image.altText: A large crowd throngs in front of the Mona Lisa painting trying to get a picture

props.synopsis: Whether it's an ancient death mask found on an Egyptian sarcophagus or the selfie you have just cropped on your phone, we have been creating portraits for centuries. So why do we love them so much?

title.children: This trend from 30BC Egypt is still influencing art today

image.altText: Dozens of tents pitched on the foreshore with the ocean waves in the background.

props.synopsis: Hamas says it offered to hand over samples of the unidentified bodies, but Israel refused and asked for the remains for examination.

title.children: Three bodies returned by Hamas are not those of hostages, Israel says

image.altText: The 100 metres pinnacle called the Pharos.

props.synopsis: Rock climbers are publicly urging others to ignore Parks Victoria's requests to avoid culturally significant routes at Mount Arapiles Dyurrite in western Victoria.

title.children: Rock climbers defy Parks Victoria requests to avoid Arapiles sites

image.altText: An aerial shot of Windsor Castle

props.synopsis: Andrew's eviction from his mansion in Windsor Castle is the latest part of a reshuffle of royals around the estate's grounds. Here's where everyone lives.

title.children: Andrew's Windsor eviction is the latest change in the royal property shuffle

image.altText: Detectives at a house.

props.synopsis: Police have charged a man in connection with the violent death of a 39-year-old woman in a home near Cessnock.

title.children: Man charged after woman's 'horrific' death in NSW Hunter home

image.altText: A smartphone with an Airbnb logo on it in front of the same logo being projected on a screen.

props.synopsis: A council in South Australia wants to charge short-stay rentals such as AirBnBs at a higher rate, saying they act as businesses.

title.children: SA council considers classing short-stay rentals as businesses

image.altText: man in maroon knit shows printed photos to his smiling elderly mother wearing a red headscarf and blue shirt.

props.synopsis: Discussing aged care in culturally diverse families can be a sensitive subject. Here's how some approached the conversation.

title.children: Why talking about aged care in multicultural families can be hard

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Let's get it straight: you'll probably do badly on this quiz, and I'll judge you. It's time to play … HARD!

title.children: Think you've got what it takes to top this quiz? Sure you do

image.altText: A red flare goes off in the crowd at a Melbourne Oasis concert.

props.synopsis: A flare let off by a crowd member at the first of three Melbourne Oasis concerts at Docklands Stadium on Friday night angers the band's co-founder Liam Gallagher, sparking an expletive-laden post.

title.children: 'You will get yours': Liam Gallagher incensed by fan's flare at Melbourne Oasis concert

image.altText: Armed police walk down a highway as smoke billows from a wrecked vehicle.

props.synopsis: The result is likely to amplify the concerns of critics, opposition groups and others who said the election was not a contest but a coronation, after the president's two main rivals were barred or prevented from running.

title.children: Tanzanian president wins disputed election with 97pc of vote

image.altText: A closeup of a blue bin containing dozens of shiny bronze pipes of various shapes and lengths.

props.synopsis: Experts say cost of living pressures, and the ability to make money quickly, is behind a surge in copper thefts which are leaving highways and sporting fields in the dark.

title.children: Increasing rates of copper theft costing Qld taxpayers millions a year

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: A prestigious private school in regional Victoria, accused of ignoring a toxic cycle of violence, has been banned from accepting new boarding students until it can prove it complies with safety standards.

title.children: Prestigious Victorian school's boarders ban until proven safe

image.altText: Rhesus macaques monkeys have been used for human research since the 1800s.

props.synopsis: A truck carrying 21 research monkeys overturned in Mississippi, spilling wooden crates labelled "live monkeys" into the tall grass near the highway.

title.children: Monkey escape in Mississippi uncovers secretive world of animal research

image.altText: A tropical island with smaller islands in the distance.

props.synopsis: Suzanne Rees joined a hike on Queensland's Lizard Island as part of a cruise stopover. She would never make it back to the boat.

title.children: Inside the tropical island cruise that ended in tragedy

image.altText: RBA sign behind market graphics

props.synopsis: Many people paying off mortgages were hoping for a cash rate cut, but recent inflation data means that is highly unlikely.

title.children: When will interest rates go down?

image.altText: Louvre soldiers

props.synopsis: The man and woman deny any involvement in the heist as investigations continue.

title.children: Two more people charged over Louvre heist in Paris

image.altText: Roshana Van der Wall working on her bird taxidermy pieces.

props.synopsis: From a taxidermied mynah bird perched on a teacup to a mammoth leatherback turtle, here are the "extraordinary creatures" these taxidermists are preserving.

title.children: Glass eyes, roadkill and preservation: Behind the scenes of taxidermy

image.altText: Maya Joint looks dejected during Hong Kong Open semifinal.

props.synopsis: Australian number one Maya Joint falls short of reaching the Hong Kong Open final, but compatriot Kimberly Birrell wins through to the tournament decider in Chennai.

title.children: Aussie teen Joint departs Hong Kong Open, Birrell reaches Chennai final

image.altText: Rear of a large krill processing ship at sea.

props.synopsis: The Australian government says it's "disappointed" after an international conservation meeting in Hobart failed to reach agreement on improved protection measures in Antarctica.

title.children: Australia criticises 'lost opportunity' for strengthened Antarctic conservation
